column3: @jarolrod \n\nAs you was the last person who checked [Using Qt Creator as an IDE](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/qt/README.md#using-qt-creator-as-an-ide), could your confirm/deny the necessary of the `contrib/bitcoin-qt.pro` for such setup?
@jarolrod \nDoes Qt Creator allow to open `*.ui` file directly (as Qt Designer does)?

> The pro file is a bit outdated. To bring the pro file up to speed, we'd need to add the following missing `.ui` files under `FORMS +=`:
> 
>     * modeloverlay.ui
> 
>     * psbtoperationsdialog.ui

... and remove `aboutdialog.ui`...

@hebasto yeah you can open up UI files individually. This pro file opens up all of them for you as well as the resources folder. I think it's more convenient to have all of them open. I don't have a strong opinion on this\n\nIt could be that no one uses it (i dont) and it could be wasting time to maintain this.
> ... it could be wasting time to maintain this.\n\nThat is my concern.

I personally do not use this as a designer. Qt Creator has its uses for working with Qt widgets to understand what can and can't be modified on the design side but outside that it's use as a design tool isn't great \n\nACK from me if this files requires resources to maintain

ACK 5f2be6e71e6130b58ebfbf81aaf48ce90dd9d179

ACK because I don't have a strong opinion, the file is not used very much, and the resulting conversation would be more man-hours than is used to maintain this file.

> Qt Creator has its uses for working with Qt widgets to understand what can and can't be modified on the design side but outside that it's use as a design tool isn't great

T
